name: The Beatles
description: The Beatles revolutionized popular music with their innovative songwriting and studio techniques, creating timeless hits like 'Hey Jude' and 'Let It Be'.

name: Led Zeppelin
description: Led Zeppelin pioneered heavy metal with their powerful performances and iconic tracks like 'Stairway to Heaven' and 'Whole Lotta Love'.

name: The Rolling Stones
description: Known as the 'bad boys' of rock, The Rolling Stones have delivered blues-infused rock anthems like 'Satisfaction' and 'Paint It Black' for over six decades.

name: Pink Floyd
description: Pink Floyd created immersive concept albums like 'The Dark Side of the Moon' and 'The Wall,' known for their elaborate live shows and deep lyrics.

name: The Who
description: The Who are famous for their energetic live performances and rock operas like 'Tommy,' with hits like 'My Generation' and 'Baba O'Riley'.

name: The Doors
description: Led by the charismatic Jim Morrison, The Doors produced haunting hits like 'Light My Fire' and 'Riders on the Storm' before Morrison's untimely death.

name: The Eagles
description: The Eagles defined the California rock sound with hits like 'Hotel California' and 'Take It Easy,' blending country and rock seamlessly.

name: Fleetwood Mac
description: Fleetwood Mac's 'Rumours' album is a 1970s classic, featuring hits like 'Go Your Own Way' and 'Dreams,' reflecting the band's personal turmoil.

name: Creedence Clearwater Revival
description: Led by John Fogerty, CCR delivered rootsy rock anthems like 'Proud Mary' and 'Bad Moon Rising,' capturing the late '60s American spirit.

name: Black Sabbath
description: Black Sabbath is credited with creating heavy metal, with dark, heavy tracks like 'Paranoid' and 'Iron Man' led by Ozzy Osbourne.

name: The Kinks
description: The Kinks blended British Invasion rock with social commentary in songs like 'You Really Got Me' and 'Waterloo Sunset'.

name: Jethro Tull
description: Jethro Tull stood out with their use of flute and classical influences, creating albums like 'Aqualung' and 'Thick as a Brick'.

name: The Byrds
description: The Byrds pioneered folk rock with their jangly sound, covering Bob Dylan songs and creating hits like 'Mr. Tambourine Man'.

name: Deep Purple
description: Deep Purple helped define hard rock with classics like 'Smoke on the Water' and 'Highway Star,' known for their virtuosic playing.

name: The Allman Brothers Band
description: The Allman Brothers Band blended blues, jazz, and rock, with epic tracks like 'Whipping Post' and live album 'At Fillmore East'.

name: Lynyrd Skynyrd
description: Lynyrd Skynyrd is the definitive Southern rock band, known for 'Sweet Home Alabama' and 'Free Bird,' despite a tragic plane crash in 1977.

name: The Moody Blues
description: The Moody Blues fused rock with orchestral elements, creating hits like 'Nights in White Satin' and albums like 'Days of Future Passed'.

name: Jefferson Airplane
description: Jefferson Airplane led the '60s counterculture with psychedelic hits like 'White Rabbit' and 'Somebody to Love'.

name: Grateful Dead
description: Grateful Dead built a cult following with their improvisational live shows and songs like 'Truckin’' and 'Casey Jones'.

name: The Animals
description: The Animals brought gritty blues rock to the British Invasion with hits like 'House of the Rising Sun' and 'Don’t Let Me Be Misunderstood'.
